Author: bace5f56977a04a37280668fff6167cd32f6b60f
column5: OPENJPA-1113 - The 2nd level Reflection class cached object (Class -> (String -> Method)) is a Method object
column6: which has a back reference back to the owning Class. The IBM JDK seems to be able to garbage-collect these caches using WeakReferenceHashMap. By forcing the value of the nested HashMap to be WeakReference
column7: using the ConcurrentReferenceHashMap class
column8: the Sun and IBM JDK 5/6 are able to release the cache content
column9: if not needed. With these changes
column10: the trunk maven build time has shortened by 5-10%.

column5: OPENJPA-1113 - Revert changes back to previous levels: Reflection:743396 & AbstractBrokerFactory 768588. I have verified that the latest changes associated to this issue did not caused any memory leak by observing/dumping the static cache sizes in the Reflection class. The emf.close() method cleared out the cache
column6: i.e. HashMap.size() == 0. From looking at the memory usage of the JVM that invoked the test in persistence-jdbc module
column7: the memory usage continues to grow even without the changes committed by this issue. Therefore there is some memory leak somewhere either in the test case or the provider code. The OOM condition only occurs with Sun JDK

Author: 1706670152d7dc09528b246fe54503876963f74a
column5: Introduces notion of @Replicated entity. This feature allows to relax collocation constraint for quasi-stationary master data. A replicated entity is stored as identical copies across multiple slices. The ReplicationStrategy works similar to DistributionStrategy for replicated entity. The slice association cardinality has uniformly changed to array of slices from a single slice name both for replicated and non-replicated entity. The non-replicated entities can refer to replicated entities but not vice versa. The query operation (especially the ones with aggregate function) is aware of replicated data and queries only one of the slices to avoid duplication.

column5: OPENJPA-659: Dirty checking fails for runtime enhanced classes. The original case reported the failure in a Spring-Tomcat-Weaver with Embdded field. But as TestSimpleUnenhancedQuery can raise the same failure in a simpler settings. The fix is related to initializing a SaveFieldManager conditional to having loaded fields at invocation of saveFields(). The fix removes the condition and ensures that a SaveFieldManager is assocaited even when saveFields() is invoked without any field loaded.

Author: b2c1e8f16ffb4fa129249ba88deba4d762adc6c3
column5: OPENJPA-544. Get rid of JDK1.4 support
column6: fold the jdk1.5 modules into their siblings
column7: get rid of some ugly reflection that was there for 1.5 support
column8: and move to the java.util.concurrent collections classes. This includes a wrapper around ConcurrentHashMap that allows nulls
column9: since the old OpenJPA concurrent map allowed nulls and we rely on that behavior. The implication is that putIfAbsent() and some of the other special JDK1.5 methods don't obey the same contracts as in the java.util.concurrent package.

Author: 44db5768cd2f7e0f3793f156f76365105ee4bd87
column5: Allow dynamic configuration property. Changes include 1. Add getter/setter for boolean 'dynamic' field of Value  2. Add Value.assertChangeable() that Value subclasses must invoke prior to set new internal state 3. Changes Configuration readOnly state from a boolean to a simple 3-step state  variable INIT_STATE_LIQUID/FREEZING/FROZEN. This is done to allow lazy instantiation of some PluginValues after the BrokerFactory freezes configuration. 4. Removes assertNotReadOnly() check from Configuration implementations' setX()  methods. 5. Removes dynamic Value related methods from Configuration API and its implementations

column5: Adding support for change of configuration properties after the configuration has been frozen.  Three methods have been added to Configuration:   i) Configuration.getDynamicValues() returns list of Values that are dynamically modifiable.  ii) Configuration.isDynamic(String property) affirms if the named property is dynamically modifiable. iii) Configuration.modifyDynamic(String property
column6: Object value) modifies the named property value even when Configuration.isReadOnly().

Author: 97b94f6aa90375ea6f39533144e4bf9477813a01
column5: OPENJPA256 this class differs from most plugins in that the plugin type is the standard java interface Map.class (rather than an openjpa-specific interface)
column6: which means that the ClassLoader used to load the implementation will be the system class loader; this presents a problem if OpenJPA is not in the system classpath
column7: so work around the problem by catching the IllegalArgumentException (which is what we wrap the ClassNotFoundException in) and try again
column8: this time using this class' ClassLoader.

Author: 80f7795fefebd6776293ad0c51417e0fccdbeadd
column5: Cleanup bugfix relating to use of a default schema declared in orm.xml: - Removed prepending of schema name in PersistenceMappingDefaults.getTableName   methods as unnecessary. - Moved storage of default schema name to ClassMappingInfo as that's the only   place we use it for now. - Moved setting of default schema name into the more efficient endClassMapping   method of XMLPersistenceMappingParser. - Fixed MappingInfo.createTable logic to pass the full table name to    SchemaGroup.findTable.  This is important b/c the DynamicSchemaGroup (used   during the mappingtool's buildSchema action
column6: the default for JPA) dynamically   adds the table to itself during the findTable operation.  Without the full   table name it would always add the table to the default schema.

column7: rather than just user-defined properties.  This ensures that on deserialization we get the proper settings despite not running product derivations.  Previous attempt caused problems on SunONE.

column6: changed references to external symbolic constants to use constants from the map impl being used
column7: and reduced if-else statements for readability.

Author: 018cf3278a4f28f012bef3f8942273492404f737

column5: OPENJPA-150 : Re-use parseColumns method when parsing AttributeOverride columns so that we get secondary table information.

Author: 1b446958f5699c2adecb3163ab9ce44b873b2f57
column5: OPENJPA-146 : When copying an OID superclass field for re-mapping
column6: revert type to PC.  It will re-resolve to OID on its own when the field's metadata is resolved
column7: and in the meantime it will ensure we use the same path for  metadata resolution as non-copied fields.

Author: 4f102a7c77a321699663e9fba7449725e52d86ba
column5: Capturing reference to the Column[] at the creation time in the RowImpl instead of the Table
column6: to work with DynamicSchemaFactory where the Table's columns can get modified after the creation of the RowImpl before the flush.

Author: 09e7aab7778db72e6412625f39a9557d6a2646be
column5: Capture the version fields into the memento when setting the savepoint and restore the version information into the StateManagerImpl as a part of the rollbackToSavepoint call. Fix addresses OPENJPA-154.

Author: 8974a099084986706a14419fa3e2298541ee50e1
column5: Only substantive change is flipping the order of the args in an  ImplHelper.isAssignable call in FetchConfigurationImpl.  We want to test  whether the type we're traversing to is derived from the type we're traversing from.

Author: 4efc5d69972193ee57032dce319cf1b42e0d65b1
column5: Revert "full properties caching" changes made to ConfigurationImpl -- they're  causing problems on some appservers.

Author: dfc102beba2406c0a6065e665b710431245673cc
column5: OPENJPA-141.  A few improvements to the performance-related changes done with the previous Issue.  Reference OPENJPA-141 for details.  Biggest change was moving some of the common caching code to ImplHelper.

Author: 7a2330ce3bcb238be8df2295e13c49b2994cf5ed
column5: Compare Configuration instances on their full properties
column6: including defaults. Also serialize the full properties because product derivations aren't re-run on deserialize
column7: so we need to know the complete defaults
column8: etc.  We still track the user-given properties separately so they can be used in factory pooling.

column5: Fix possible NPE introduced in recent changes to MethodLifecycleCallbacks.

Author: a2be03e9cb6e94c488c1475650eaf3ab05da7ee6
column5: Add a DiscriminatorStrategy.hasClassConditions() method rather than having the DiscriminatorStrategy.getClassConditions() method return null for no conditions so that we can detect whether the joins to the base class owning the  discriminator are necessary before making them.  Otherwise
column6: we run the risk of creating table aliases for base class tables without joining them
column7: which can result in bad SQL.

Author: d826caf71175811a23214b4e23545aee7625d7ed
column5: OPENJPA-119.  Needed to allow the EM.clear operation to perform without doing an implicit flush.  Introduced a new boolean parameter to indicate whether a flush is desired or not.  This allows both the new (correct) behaviour for JPA as well as the  old behaviour for other persistence personalities (JDO
column6: etc).  I also introduced a new testcase for this scenario
column7: and updated  a couple of other tests.

column6: due to the weak references (probable cause)
column7: I had to check for nulls when iterating through the _brokers during the close processing.

Author: 67a73ee0eaa0a903730d5fb1d5f3ffa5f0ca5f68
column5: Changed docbook build mechanism to no longer manually download the docbook files from sourgeforge.net
column6: and instead have the docbook files be a maven dependency
column7: and access the dependency directly. This is mainly because they removed the old file from http://docbook.sourceforge.net/release/xsl that we were relying on
column8: but has the side-benefit of removing one network-sensitive component from the release build probless. Unfortunately
column9: this also means that we need to downgrade from version 1.69.1 to 1.67.2 of the docbook stylesheets (since the Maven repository doesn't yet have the newer versions)
column10: but that doesn't appear to have any visible effects.

column6: in case people have a non-standard repository location.

column5: If we don't know the access type for a class when parsing

column5: Handle ClassNotFoundException and ClassCircularityError instances when trying to load the classes into the temporary class loader during enhancement. These exceptions will indicate that the class is not loadable

column5: Handle ClassNotFoundException and ClassCircularityError instances when trying to load the classes into the temporary class loader during enhancement. These exceptions will indicate that the class is not loadable
column6: and so they couldn't have any persistent metadata anyway.

column6: this message discusses concrete means for configuration that are not really in the purview of openjpa-kernel. But the benefit of directly mentioning the causes of the problem outweigh the coupling to the underlying configuration mechanisms
column7: at least until we decide to move the error message generation to spec-dependent subtypes.

column7: since they might be used in their JDBC implementation when the original query was executed against the database.

Author: 396efa6ae6e2d33623e5b73603440058aa6ca6b5
column5: Support native queries making stored procedure calls
column6: or insert
column7: update
column8: delete. For native queries returning ResultSet should use getResultList or getSingleResult interfaces on Query. For native queries performing updates without returning any results use executeUpdate interface on Query.

column5: A single class may not have more than one lifecycle callback method for the same lifecycle event (spec section 3.5). The contraint applies irrespective of whether the class is a persistent bean or a listener or both.

Author: d823825a34b49a2a01be0f6609aa2f8aa1683d39
column5: Allow configurable set of known unproxyable types.

Author: 847b33aa6eaba2ea1f8ccd1009baccea79b08f22
column5: Allow updating in-memory values with complex expressions
column6: rather than just simple Constants and Literals.

Author: 53614b371f55034b142374263fe640eb75181f07
column5: Prevent the end range of a substring from going over the end of the string.

Author: 4e85c5eb84746ed18b23230fc7aae81bd635b4d8
column5: Making loading of build-time generated proxies overridable by subclasses.

Author: 597930f15a699dc1411fb8372e865cd1938dbb6e
column5: JPA says an EM should act closed when close() has been invoked even if the persistence context remains open while the current managed transaction  completes.

Author: d8be93089cba9c9a129ea229d91fede7ef23c02d
column5: Generate proxies for all standard java.util types during jar packaging.

Author: d6dbadaa3cc643b201ca478885e3bde9d77543ed
column5: Option to create proxies for standard java.util types at build time.  These proxies can be serialized as proxies for use with detached state managers
column6: whereas runtime-generated proxies have to serialize themselves as a copied  instance of their corresponding java.util type in case they are transferred to  a different classloading environment.

Author: dfca20d46580f52ae2c4f75f450e1c30d96e0cb4
column5: Processing <metadata-complete> and <xml-mapping-metadata-complete>

Author: 148d8f8df2969cc4a57347f3128c682f2491c1b4
column5: Wrap non-Collection arguments in Collections so that the query language can support having both varargs "in" clauses as well as clauses that take a Collection parameter.

Author: 74589c8ae1859472b711ff924599e66cd9eb7da6
column5: Use most derived available classloader when loading plugins so that we can  load application classes when the application uses a derived loader.

Author: 0ffb985316140a49fb1e0c868e97f57d7f6c9ace
column5: Allow the parameter to an IN(?) expression to be a Collection type
column6: which allows variable-length IN parameters. The spec is a little vague about whether this should be allowed or not
column7: but there's no reason not to support it.

Author: 6dff15b02f9dfad0424932d6940ec69ecf33b98c
column5: Serialize proxies to non-proxy copies.

Author: 600d949140636d03582c919c963bd58a2d27e824
column5: Copy all calendar parameters that go towards equals() comparisons.

Author: 9dcdd3a35d12192efff07ca0eef80578ca7659c9
column5: Improved error message.

Author: d85fbdee04a52287feddf4bb628b0d48d16a2bc2
column5: Fix calendar proxy bug.

Author: 7b91f912736827bfa84787a725889889a5ba90f7
column5: Bytecode proxy fixes.

Author: db174a951274655dd18c63ad7d36a75124949e01
column5: Better error message when attempting to proxy final class.

Author: 770abf1aa83527c77a1ed984246d55376f68533e
column5: Don't proxy final classes.

Author: d44b353278a4985314a8543a166e255c88df754c
column5: Document capabilities of new proxy manager.

Author: e54b0c19086fdbc764e6ea67c86251021bf11b8e
column5: Move to dynamically-created bytecode proxies for second class objects
column6: rather than checked-in proxy classes.  This allows us to proxy custom collection
column7: map

Author: db25f08565e48ea639e9c7dcf5feb6905efc5d30
column5: Terminate loop when connection attempt succeeds.

Author: 4a03860c2f4dab8a169bf6968e23d91795d42f55
column5: Not using the cached version of zip file.  For deploy-undeploy-redeply
column6: the iterator was holding stale reference to the cached zip content. The 'close' flag is no more required
column7: the zip file is closed as dictated by the user of the iterator.

Author: ee33aa7af3ed765aee95e38773b042c1e5194fbe
column5: Default name fix.

Author: d5fb9486ba9d56875f20d44affe031c19273de13
column5: Add backward compat property doc.

Author: 87dc2aad7c2a8f11639dc0b4f875137728b93a65
column5: Correct bug in our default for the name of an inverse join column within a join table.  Added configurable property for users to retain the old defaulting for compatibility if desired.

column5: Added property svn:eol-style=native

column5: Added property svn:eol-style=native

Author: eb9a626945d62e44112259e777f54db833063682

Author: dbcdfb9ff98a38845ce0e89daf3a6b848e682281

Author: 970f6476220315a836c71641d2b262b6e7b959a3
column5: Resolving JIRA report OPENJPA-63 for better pessimistic lock support for DB2.  Instead of the usual "for update" clause
column6: db2 dictionary will now use "with rr use and keep update locks" clause.

Author: ca45e3292a7520b58bf31adf2b4ac099ce6416d6
column5: Changed syncWithManagedTransaction to return true if a transaction is already active (rather than throwing an exception)
column6: since section 5.9.2 of the JPA spec suggests that it should be legal to invoke EntityManager.joinTransaction() multiple times.

Author: 16f78782dd4bd189a15d1d1d13b7045872411a91

column6: which appears to have been accidentally added. The file is actually released under Sun's CDDL.

Author: fff0cd889ad4921aee34bcaf528814d64a6ab533

column5: Specify that LICENSE.txt and NOTICE.txt be included in the top-level or the source distribution (although it is additionally contained in the openjpa-project/ directory).

column6: if no diagnostic context is specified in the log configuration property.

column6: not at the OpenJPAConfiguration level.

column6: and put logic in PersistenceUnitInfoImpl to set the openjpa.Id property to the persistence unit name if no openjpa.Id property is discovered.

Author: 71ed42e8c59e6ba343f8bb80a3d7355a52b3886a

Author: 535d6a9f9452fd93672d99dd8e05a50beb281b81
column5: Simplify the usage of the WAS ExtendedJTATransaction API.  We only need to check the globalId (and not the localId) for presence of a global (user) transaction.  Also corrected some of the exception processing and tracing of exceptions for rollback processing.

column6: plus a tweak to make it use resources instead of files.

column6: we can reassess the need to move to 1.12.

Author: b4077bd6a64f73fd28c210f265d5ef8b089199dd
column5: OPENJPA-74: Fixed multiple problems with named queries: 1. They were not being parsed as part of the orm.xml file
column6: since we were incorrectly looking for an attribute named 'query' (when it really should have been a sub-element named 'query'). 2. Looking for a named query did not force resolution of all metadatas. 3. An NPE was being thrown when a JPQL query was created with a null filter

Author: 22226fc0f4b49f5cdb16792e0901d94ae7d838b7

Author: fbc9da9dfe3bc8d9aff204143854227f5190b031
column5: Fixed license to be the Apache 2.0 license.

Author: caa1ea4543411cd254d218b1baaa748ebad1633f

column6: since it works around a problem with the 2.0 version of the plugin that doesn't add dependencies to the doc class path.

Author: a493e790b7d3a560bcb52872c6aa709dc5b95877
column5: Removed some dead code and unused imports.

Author: 0a96982e61dadc190d809790e41da922ba715bfb

Author: 10a9e2e7ba58d25c13e628043726d379c8329630

column5: Move build logic for adding an interface to WASManagedRuntime's inner class to WASManagedRuntime itself.  Move caching in WASManagedRuntime to  endConfiguration() callback to avoid threading issues.

Author: 1af459a4966d5f5a2c03fdd00331c2cc6a40c277

Author: ea81e824352cfcaf5753b467c8477c667a3a1902

column5: Take advantage StringUtils where appropriate.

Author: 08d69d15a7f03fedfeb872caa9005b89c61560ff

column5: OPENJPA-14. Use the class's classloader in environments when service lookups should be looking in the OpenJPA distribution. This imposes the restriction that OpenJPA will only find services in the same classloader as the OpenJPA jars themselves
column6: which is a much better restriction than requiring that the classes be in the thread's context classloader.

column5: Updated the SVN properties to ignore the target directories at each of the OpenJPA sub-project levels (openjpa-jdbc
column6: openjpa-jdbc-5
column7: etc).  Some of the sub-projects already had the svn:ignore property for the target directory
column8: but not all of them.  I also updated the properties to ignore any "dot files" at the top most OpenJPA (ie. trunk) level.  This will help with ignoring the metadata files associated with IDE's such as Eclipse (.classpath and .project) and NetBeans (.netbeans).

Author: 037a45d7e4a7b57146b33c70598b9376374f21de
column5: Add visitor pattern to query expression trees
column6: and redo a couple of our existing tree interrogation methods to use it.  This will allow us to add more  validations at query compilation time (we're missing some that are required for JDO 2
column7: for example) without having to expand the API of every query  expression/value implementation
column8: in addition to just being more flexible  overall.

Author: eb2b5e65516d55cb7fd75c92f7a70c0216f28104
column5: Method visibility fix.

Author: 69b83ac3ffdc0421d5a8c68a7d825bc87169a91b
column5: When a query projects and groups on a relation field
column6: make sure to group on the same columns we select.  Added Select.groupBy(ClassMapping
column7: ...) API. Implemented by temporarily putting target Select into "group mode" -- in which  all select() calls are instead routed to groupBy() calls -- and invoking the  same JDBCStoreManager.select() logic we use for the  Select.select(ClassMapping...) call.  Having the Select "fake out" its callers by translating select() calls into groupBy() calls isn't necessarily pretty
column8: but it allows us to re-use all our existing select logic (not just in  JDBCStoreManager
column13: etc  mapping strategies) rather than creating duplicate logic in parallel groupBy()  methods in all these components.

Author: 2ccc2426791f4846704098e8564753faad665442
column5: When a relation mapping uses the expected class of the related type as part of its join criteria (in addition to the standard foreign key join)
column6: make sure discriminator conditions are appended to the WHERE SQL not only when loading the relation
column7: but also when traversing it in queries.

column5: Allow our JPA ConfigurationProviderImpl to find a default persistence unit in persistence.xml when no explicit configuration is given to dev tools.  Do this in a backwards-compatible way that won't break previous behavior or other facade behavior (JDO).  This means you should no longer have to pass  "-p persistence.xml" to tools like the enhancer
column6: nor should you have to specify a properties argument to the PCEnhancerAgent in the premain for runtime  enhancement.

This has the downside of mandating that there must be at least one valid product derivation and one valid configuration provider available (theoretically someone using brokers directly together with a simpl store like the sample XML store wouldn't need  either)
column6: but otherwise the final error message to the user is often meaningless.

column5: Cleanup of fetch group metadata and internal runtime APIs. Now that fetch depth information is immutable within a fetch instance and cloned on relation  traversal
column6: it was safe to combine fetch state back into the fetch configuration  class and remove the fetch state class for cleaner APIs (no more having some components use fetch state and others fetch configuration). Also changed recursion depth logic to more accurately mirror intent (per JDO spec)
column7: though  testing is needed.

column5: Pass "-p persistence.xml" to enhancer invocation when running persistence  tests so that we don't have to set JPA defaults in the JPA  ConfigurationProviderImpl.beforeConfigurationLoad
column6: which is incompatible with having JDO
column7: etc providers in the same system.  Eventually we should probably  recognize persistence.xml as a defaults file
column8: but for now that's against our  previous contract of allowing a user to have a JDO
column9: etc defaults file and a  persistence.xml in the same system.  Also removed XML Transformer functionality from XMLFactory
column10: since we don't use it and it causes problems with Ant (this seems to be an Ant+JDK 1.5 bug in Ant).
